A few months ago, I opened an email that changed everything. I remembered a story about a man who lost his wedding ring in the ocean. Ten years later, he found it in a fish he was eating. That’s how I felt when I read an email from a man named Keith Rushton, who fixes and sells guitars. He told me, “I have your electric guitar.” It had been sold many times since I gave it away. Keith found my name on a label on the guitar and looked for me online. He contacted me through the newspaper I work for and wanted to sell it back to me. I was so happy I almost cried. He asked for a fair price, and I was ready to pay anything for it.
I remembered how my dad liked to put name labels on everything I owned, even my guitar. My parents wanted me to learn classical guitar because it was popular in the 1970s. I loved the sound of it; it was calm and gentle. But I didn’t get better at it, so I switched to electric guitar, which was easier. At that time, punk music was popular, and anyone could be a rock star, even if they didn’t play well.
When I opened the box with my old guitar, I remembered my birthday in 1978 when my parents gave it to me. The guitar felt smooth and smaller than I remembered. I sat down to play, but then I stood up and put the strap over my shoulder because that’s how you play electric guitar. My fingers remembered where to go. I couldn’t draw the chords, but my hands knew what to do. My fingers felt a little pain from pressing the strings.
The electric guitar is not usually played alone. Now that I am learning it again, I think I should start a band. My son is learning the saxophone, so maybe we can play together. Or maybe I can find other people my age who feel like I do. We could call ourselves “The Regainers!”

There has been a lot of talk about sleep recently. I wrote a book called Insomniac about people who cannot sleep well. I wanted to warn people about the dangers of not getting enough sleep. Lack of sleep can affect our minds, bodies, and feelings. People who have trouble sleeping know how important sleep is. It is good that people are now paying more attention to sleep. 
But what about dreams? I have not heard much about dreams in this conversation. We often lose our dreams. When you wake up early because of an alarm, you miss the last hour or two of sleep. This lost sleep is mostly REM sleep, which is when we dream the most. Our best and most memorable dreams happen in REM sleep just before we wake up. A good sleeper spends about a quarter of their sleep time in REM. If a person lives for 90 years, they will spend six or seven years dreaming in REM.
When researchers take away REM sleep from people, they find that the next night, people have more REM sleep. This shows that dreams are important. In 1953, researchers found REM sleep, and many agreed with psychologist Sigmund Freud, who said that understanding dreams helps us understand our minds. However, later studies showed that this was not so simple. Now, researchers focus more on the physical reasons for dreams rather than the psychological ones. 
Currently, there is not much agreement among dream researchers, according to Robert Stickgold from Harvard University. Dreams are important. At a meeting of sleep experts, P.F. Pagel from the University of Colorado found that actors, writers, and directors remember and use their dreams better than others. He believes that creative people use their dreams more. This makes sense because films are very dream-like.
But I wonder, do only creative people need their dreams? Don’t teachers, software designers, and politicians also need to think creatively? Stickgold says that dreams help us connect ideas in new and surprising ways. They help us find new patterns and think differently. For example, when people are woken from REM sleep and asked to think of something related to a word, their ideas are more original than when they wake from other sleep stages. They think outside the box and make surprising connections. This is what creativity is.
I find that I write better after having intense dreams. Even a bad dream can help me think better. On those days, ideas come to me quickly, and I can hardly keep up with my typing. I don’t know how it works, but it does help. Creativity is not just for writers or artists. We all live in a complex world. We need our brains to work well. We need to think creatively in our relationships with colleagues, family, and friends. This is why dreaming is important.

Twenty years ago, Susie Ray left London to live in a small town by the sea in south-west England. When you enter her studio, you see many empty frames on the walls and pictures of her two daughters. Susie is a talented artist who copies famous paintings. She can make copies of beautiful paintings from the early 20th century and the 16th century. It is strange that she does not keep any of her own work. “I don’t have any of my own around,” Susie says. “As soon as I finish them, they go.” 
Many people want her work. In her 30 years as a copyist, she has painted many famous artists like Renoir, Monet, and Van Gogh. Her copies are so good that experts sometimes think they are the real paintings. The real paintings can sell for millions of pounds, but her copies sell for a few hundred pounds to £12,000, depending on how long she works on them. Susie does not tell who her clients are, but they include art galleries and private collectors. Some collectors want to show off their art, and one famous buyer likes to say he has a ‘Van Gogh’ painting, but it is really a ‘Susie Ray Van Gogh’. 
Susie is honest about her work. When she copies a famous painting, she tries to make it look as real as possible. She believes that doing a bad job would be unfair to the original artist. However, she puts her name on the back of the canvas. It is illegal to sell a copy as the real painting, and even though some people make money that way, Susie does not want to take that risk. She knows that people who make fake art often get into trouble. 
Susie has not always been a copyist. After finishing her art degree, she worked as an illustrator for a botanical garden. She did not earn much money, but it helped her learn important skills. She had to be very careful and get things right the first time. She is happy she found a job that pays better now. 
When young artists ask Susie for advice, she tells them to learn to draw well and to be accurate. She has studied a lot to do her work. She can draw plants and make copies of old paintings, but she now focuses on French impressionists like Manet, Cezanne, and Degas. 
Some people think modern art is easy, but Susie believes that impressionists worked hard and paid attention to detail. It is not as simple as it seems. People wonder why Susie does not create her own art. She says her work comes from years of practice, and she makes a good living from it. She has tried to make her own art, like oil paintings of fishing nets, but they looked too much like photographs. 
Susie is a perfectionist, and she enjoys her work.

Ellen MacArthur loved the sea more than anything else when she was a racer. Since she was a child, she wanted to be the fastest on the water. She felt a strong connection with her boats, and when she was back on land, life felt boring. She wanted to be back at sea, challenging herself against nature, even in dangerous places.
After she finished second in a big solo race around the world, she showed me her small boat, Kingfisher. She lived in a tiny cabin for 94 days. She planned everything carefully, even how many rolls of kitchen paper she needed. She was proud of her simple food and her small gas stove. Her boat was very important to her, and she took good care of it because her life depended on it.
Now, Ellen sees the world like a boat: small and beautiful, but also fragile. She had a big change in her thinking when she visited South Georgia, a lonely island in the South Atlantic. There, she helped with a study of albatross birds. This experience made her think differently about the world. She saw many old whaling stations and felt it was a warning. She realized that people often take what they want and leave.
When I visited Ellen at her office, she was finishing a busy phone call. She told me why we need to act now to save the planet. She said that coal, oil, and gas are limited resources. We need to find ways to use less. At first, she focused on using less, but then she started to talk about re-using things, like special carpet tiles.
For three years, she has been visiting factories and talking to businesses and governments about our use of resources. She said, “I will never be an expert, but I love learning.” She felt that sailing was selfish compared to her new mission. She wants to find out how to use her voice to help. 
Ellen also started the Ellen MacArthur Foundation, a charity that helps young people think about a sustainable future. She misses the adventure of being at sea because it is a big part of who she is. She felt connected to everything around her and focused on survival. Now, her message is more complex than just wanting to be the fastest. She believes this work is more important than anything she has done before.

Jordan Romero is 13 years old and wants to be the youngest person to climb Mount Everest. If he succeeds, he could become very famous. He hopes to inspire other kids to go outside and climb their own mountains. Jordan's climbing team includes his father, Paul, and his mother, Karen. They call themselves "Team Romero." Climbing Everest is just one of their goals. If Jordan climbs Everest and Vinson Massif in Antarctica, he will be the youngest person to climb the Seven Summits, which are the highest mountains on each continent. Very few people do this before they turn thirty. Jordan has already climbed five of these mountains and might finish before he is a teenager.
Many famous climbers think it is not a good idea to take a 13-year-old up Mount Everest. They believe that while Jordan may be strong, he might not be emotionally ready. They also think he may not have enough experience to make good decisions while climbing. Paul and Karen have heard these opinions before. Paul says, "I know people criticize us, but we have a lot to do. We think about the risks, but we believe our experience will help. Watching Jordan grow gives me confidence."
Paul also wants to make sure that Jordan really wants to do this. He says, "This project is not about me becoming famous through my son. At first, Jordan thought he would do this later, but we decided, 'Why not now?' We talk to him often to see if he still wants to do it." When asked what he enjoys about the challenge, Jordan says, "I just focus on achieving my goal."
In the past, not many people cared about being the youngest or fastest climber. Now, every adventure is shared online, and people want to see records broken. This creates a problem for Jordan. Some people think that trying to achieve records can take away the fun of climbing. But if Jordan wants to inspire others, he needs to share his journey online, take photos, and give interviews. He needs to do something amazing, like climbing Everest.
Paul adds, "If Jordan comes home tomorrow and says he wants to stop climbing and play basketball instead, we will stop this project and go to the gym."

When you see a teenager with an MP3 player, they are probably not listening to classical music. Most people can name many pop groups, but if you ask my friends about Brahms, they look confused. I just started studying music, but my classmates know as little about classical music as other teenagers. If you don’t know who wrote the music, you probably don’t have any of their recordings. This is sad for people who love classical music. Last year, only 3% of concert tickets sold were for classical music, and most classical recordings sell only 300 copies. This is hard to believe.
So, why are fewer people interested in classical music? Older people often blame our love for TV and video games, but I don’t think that is the reason. The truth is that classical music does not attract most people, especially teenagers, who buy the most music and concert tickets. I know some teenagers who go to classical concerts, but they are not many. Even though I play in an orchestra, I don’t really like classical music. I enjoy many types of music, but I listen to classical music very little.
Why don’t teenagers like classical music? First, classical music has many changes in mood and rhythm, which can be hard for us. We like fast talking, fast playing, and fast thinking. Experts say we can only pay attention for about three minutes, which is too short for most classical pieces but just right for pop songs. Pop music is simple and easy to listen to, while classical music needs more time and focus. Also, pop music talks about things that interest teenagers, while classical music often does not.
How we listen to music has changed too. In the past, families would play music together at home, and playing an instrument was important. Now, we can find any music we want online, but we rarely hear classical music in our daily lives. When was the last time you heard classical music in a store? One of my teachers says that more people are going to classical concerts now. Maybe, but I don’t think many of them are teenagers. In my orchestra, we play classical music in many places, but when I look at the audience, I mostly see older people. 
I don’t know why more middle-aged people like classical concerts, but I do know that if your parents love something, you might want to avoid it. Some people say schools are to blame for teenagers not liking classical music, but many kids want to play classical music in their school orchestras. They come early to practice and stay late to rehearse. They enjoy playing classical music, but it is not their favorite music to listen to. When we want to relax, we always choose pop music.

Bonnie Wyndham got out of her mother’s car and looked at Almonside School. “I’ll make you sorry I’ve come here,” she said with a smile. Her mother was getting out of the car too, so she didn’t hear Bonnie, but Bonnie didn’t mind. Her mother knew how she felt. 
Mrs. Wyndham looked around. Almonside was a strange school with many buildings hidden in the trees on a hill. It looked confusing at first. Then she saw signs: Science block, gym, riding center… “Riding center,” Bonnie said, suddenly interested. “Headmaster’s study,” her mother said. “This way.” Bonnie followed her mother along a wide path between the trees. 
“I wish you’d walk beside me instead of following me like a dog,” Mrs. Wyndham said tiredly, but she didn’t expect Bonnie to do it. A few minutes later, her mother was talking to Bonnie’s new headmaster in his study, while Bonnie waited outside the door. Suddenly, Bonnie stood up. “Why should I just sit here?” she thought. “I’ll be thrown out soon anyway, so why not go now?” She left the building and went to the riding center, following the sign. 
There was a nice old building for the horses and a big place for indoor riding. Bonnie looked around, but no one was there. She walked carefully to the horses, treating them with respect. The horses were well cared for. Almost every stall had a horse, and she looked at each one. “I know what you’re doing here,” she said to a small pony, gently touching its nose. 
Then she saw the next horse and stopped. “But aren’t you the best!” she said. He was brown with a little white. He looked lively, and Bonnie liked that. “I feel like we’ve met before,” she said, stroking his neck. His name was Maverick. She really wanted to ride him. “I wonder where I can find a bridle and a saddle,” she thought. 
Bonnie was happy to find that the room with the riding equipment was open. She forgot about her mother and the headmaster while she put a saddle on Maverick. When she sat on the big horse outside, she felt like a queen. At her old school, they called her Queen Bee, and she laughed as she remembered it. “You’re the best horse I’ve ever ridden, Maverick,” she said. “I know about horses, even if I don’t know about anything else.” 
She nudged him to walk, then to trot. “If I stay here, I think we could be great friends,” she said. She rode around the paddock, feeling the wind on her face. She could tell Maverick trusted her, and she felt sure he would jump well.

I have met Cody Simpson before, and I was impressed by his quiet confidence. Cody is a 15-year-old from Australia. He has already released many successful songs. How did this relaxed surfer become a star in front of many fans? 
Cody says, “I first picked up a guitar when I was six years old and started writing songs when I was seven.” He loved swimming and surfing more than anything else at that time. When he was 13 and in high school, he posted some videos online. These videos changed everything. He started with a video of him and a friend singing at a school concert. Fans wanted to see more of his videos on social media. So, Cody recorded more videos at home, and the fans loved them.
Cody was also a great swimmer. He trained hard with good coaches. But then, record labels wanted him to sign a deal. He had to choose: stay in Australia and keep swimming or take a big risk and move to the US with his family. Cody decided to take the chance. 
He said, “It was very difficult for me – especially at such a young age – to choose a career. Can you imagine being 12 or 13 years old and trying to decide what you want to do for the rest of your life?” He had to tell his swimming coach and friends that he was moving to America. Most people were surprised because he was a quiet kid. 
Cody packed his bags and moved with his family to another part of the world. He gave up one dream to try to make another dream come true. His family stays out of the spotlight but supports him. Cody believes it is important to have good people around you to stay grounded.
Sometimes, he feels doubt. He thinks about how his decision affects his little brother and sister. His brother is eight years old and travels the world, doing school on the road. Cody worries about how this affects him, but his family always supports him.
Cody believes that success comes from being ready to say ‘yes’ to big opportunities, even if it is scary. He says, “It all just happened so fast and unexpectedly. Now, I go to countries I never thought I would visit and play in front of many fans. It is like a dream for many people. But I know it won’t last forever.”

I jumped out of bed, pulled back a corner of the curtain, and looked at the river. There was a new crack in the ice shining in the morning sun. I squinted and looked upstream at the sandbags. They were there to stop the buildings from flooding when the ice melted. My back still hurt from lifting the sandbags last week. I worked hard with many people in the town to help. But my grandfather did not notice my effort.
I looked at the dark water from the factory. There was ice on both sides, but the water was open in the middle. As I took off my pajamas and put on my kayaking wetsuit, I saw a boy on the other side of the river. I did not know him. He was trying to balance on the ice near the warm water from the factory. I zipped up my wetsuit and put on my kayaking jacket. I checked my pocket for my lucky silver chain. My famous grandfather gave it to me after his trip to South America. Only my grandfather, my mom, and I know about it. I also have his diary from that trip. I keep it under my pillow and read it before I sleep. I touched the chain and went to the kitchen.
“Good morning, Rex,” my mom said with a smile as I took a banana from the counter. “You’re up early for a Saturday. I will make brunch after your training. Be careful.” 
“Thanks, Mom.” I walked down the hall and almost bumped into my tall grandfather as he came out of his room. 
“Can’t you watch where you’re going?” he shouted. “Where are you going?” 
“Sorry, Grandpa. I’m going kayaking.” It was clear because I was wearing my wetsuit. He always saw me in my kayak every morning. Grandpa can be hard to deal with when he gets angry. 
“What’s the point of training? You didn’t win the competition,” he said. His words hurt, but I took a deep breath and counted to three. He went into the bathroom and slammed the door. My mom came over with a kind smile. 
“Don’t mind him. He’s…” 
“...not himself right now,” I finished for her. I wanted to say he was always like this, but I tried to be nice to him. When I was little, he was my hero. He showed me pictures of himself in National Geographic magazine. Those old pictures are still on his wall, with his medals and trophies. But I don’t go into his room anymore. I have my own trophies to look at, and maybe one day, my own picture in National Geographic. Still, I want to stay close to him, even if he is grumpy.
Mom smiled. “At least he is coming out of his room more. Have a good training session, Rex. I admire your determination to keep going, even in this cold weather!” 
I smiled back as I peeled my banana. “It will be warmer in South America if I find sponsors for my trip.” She laughed and went back to the kitchen. I finished my banana and went downstairs. I stepped into the backyard and hurried to the boathouse.

Mum grabbed Jess by the arm. "Come with me," she said. Jess followed her to the study. On the table, there was a painting by Grandpa. It was not framed and looked different from his other work. It was not finished. 
"Do you know anything about this?" Mum asked. Jess shook her head. "I’ve never seen it before. I didn’t know he was working on anything." Jess looked closely at the painting. It showed a river, but it was not a river she knew. It looked like a fantasy river. The painting was strange and beautiful in a spooky way. The riverbank was very small, with just a little green. The eye was drawn to the light water and a hidden sea. There were no animals, birds, or people in the painting, and it felt right that way. Jess thought about autumn coming after a long summer.
Mum spoke again. "It has a name." There was something in her voice that showed she was excited. Jess knew why. Grandpa never named his paintings. He just painted them and let others think about them. Mum turned the painting over and pointed to the words Grandpa had written. Jess read them: "River Boy." The words felt important to her, but she didn’t know why. 
Jess looked at Mum. "There is no boy." 
"Exactly. It’s strange for him to be so specific. But maybe he will add the boy later. I made the mistake of asking him about it." 
"Mum! You should have known better." 
"I know, but I couldn’t help it. It’s such an unusual painting, especially with a name. You can guess what he said." 
Jess didn’t need to guess. She knew Grandpa would say, "It’s not the artist's job to explain a painting. Each painting has its own life and language, like a poem. We either understand it or we don’t. Painting is hard work, and I can’t waste time explaining it to everyone." 
Mum laughed. "Something like that. Anyway, I was hoping you might know something about this painting since you seem to inspire him." 
"Inspire?" Jess asked. 
"Yes, someone who helps an artist." Jess knew what it meant. Grandpa often said it when she watched him paint. He would say the muse was not helping him or that he needed to be nice to the muse. But he never said it was about her. She thought a muse was like a goddess, not a real person. It was hard to think anyone could inspire someone as strong-willed as Grandpa. 
"He doesn’t need me to inspire him," she said. "He has been painting all his life."

This morning, I woke up and accidentally cut a hole in my bedroom carpet. I didn’t mean to do it. I could have tripped over the bed with my dad’s knife in my hand, and the knife might have gone into the carpet. That could have happened, but I’m not saying it did. I just didn’t want to damage the carpet. I didn’t wake up thinking, “Today I will cut a hole in my carpet.” It seemed like a good idea at the time, but later I wondered why I thought that. This happens to me a lot. 
What I was really doing was trying to fit my corner cabinet into a corner. My grandma gave me this cabinet when she moved to a flat. It is very cute! It is small, painted white, and has pink and blue flowers on it. It has tiny glass doors. Grandma used to keep pretty things in it, like little figures. Now, I keep my shells and stones in there. I was very happy when she gave it to me!
The cabinet is a corner cabinet, so it has to go in a corner. My bedroom is small and shaped like a wedge of cheese. There are two corners in my room. The big bedroom is for my parents, my sister Angela has the back room, and my brother Tom has the little room over the garage. I have the smallest room, which is like a broom cupboard. 
Mum says when Angela goes to university, Tom can have her room, and I can have Tom’s room. But Angela is only fifteen, so I think I will be in my small room for a long time. I don’t mind; I like my little bedroom. It feels cozy, like a nest. The roof slopes down, and the window is low. 
The problem is, there are not many corners! My bed is in one corner, and my wardrobe is in the other. I tried to fit Grandma’s cabinet in the space between the roof and the floor, but it was too tall. I thought, if I can’t cut the cabinet, maybe I can cut a hole in the carpet. It seemed like a good idea. My dad always tells us to “think outside the box,” and that is what I was trying to do!

The novel "The Borrowers" is about a family of tiny people who live secretly in the walls and floors of a house. They borrow things from normal-sized people to survive. When I was asked to make a TV show from the book, I knew it would be hard to meet people's expectations. Fans of the book have strong ideas about how it should be. I used the original drawings from the book a lot because I didn’t want people to say I did it wrong.
The author wanted the show to show things from the Borrowers' point of view, not from the humans'. This made filming more difficult. The most important thing was to get the size right. The Borrowers are ten times smaller than humans. So, when we filmed them walking across a room, we had to be ten times further away than usual. The crew had to crawl on the ground and film from no higher than 15 centimeters to show the Borrowers' view. They went through many pairs of jeans!
We only raised the cameras for special shots. One big challenge was to make the shadows look right when we combined the tiny Borrowers with the normal-sized background. We created a special way to do this. After the show aired, famous director George Lucas called me to ask how I did it.
We built only one set, which was the Borrowers' home under the floorboards. It was filled with giant objects to make the actors look small. It was very fun. I remember the coins we used; they were bigger than dinner plates and hard to lift. We often had to stop filming because the crew laughed so much. In the story, there is a scene where the Borrowers are swept down a drain. To film this, the actors had to go down a tunnel with hoses, and they said it was so scary that they didn’t need to act.
It was also important to me to get the costumes right. I had them made from heavy canvas so they looked like doll clothes. This made it hard for the main actress to move. She couldn’t sit down during breaks and had to be sewn into her dress every morning. The lead actor's trousers were made from a rug because normal fabric looked too smooth. Unfortunately, it was very hot while we filmed, and I don’t think they were happy with the costumes!
Most of the action away from the Borrowers' home was filmed with the actors in front of a blue screen. It was hard for them to react to things that weren’t really there. I had to draw pictures of every scene to show how they should look. I drew 2,000 pictures by the end. We didn’t have enough money to use special effects studios during the day, so I worked nights for three months. We had to work quickly. Once, I filmed a whole scene and then realized there was no film in the camera!
But in the end, everything came together, and I think the series was successful in showing the magic of the books.

Mom stops the car at the corner of my new school, Palm Grove High School. She looks around nervously, searching for reporters that are not there. I wonder how long it will take before the craziness starts. It always does. The fake smiles, the people who want to be my friends, and the ones who ask for free tickets to my dad’s concerts. “Everything will be fine,” I tell her. She kisses her fingertip and touches my cheek before I get out of the car. Then she drives away, leaving me alone at this new school. But this is what I wanted. I wanted to leave my old life of traveling and tutors. While the rest of the band is here for recording, we are staying for good. I wanted to come to this school because I want to meet real kids. Kids with normal parents, like a mom who works in an office or a dad who cuts grass. That would be so cool.
I walk into the school office. “Hi, I need my schedule, please,” I say to the secretary. “Name?” she asks, looking unfriendly. “Desert McGraw.” “Desirée?” she asks, leaning closer. “Desert,” I say again. The secretary looks confused. “Oh,” she says and types my last name on her computer. That’s good because not many people know my last name since my dad uses a stage name. “What grade?” she asks. “Eleventh.” “One second, it’s printing,” she says. Then she gives me the paper. My first class is English Literature. Great! I like English. But I will be late. English is in Room 214 on the second floor. I studied the map last night so I wouldn’t look silly looking for my class.
When I get to the door, I hear the teacher calling names. “Aurelio Gonzalez.” “Here.” I slip in quietly and sit at the last desk in the second row. The girl next to me smiles. She looks at my normal outfit – jeans and a T-shirt. “Nice shoes,” she whispers. I look down at my fancy shoes with flowers. Oh no, I shouldn’t have worn these. “Thanks,” I say. The teacher pauses. “Desert... McGraw?” she says. “Here.” The teacher smiles and introduces herself as Ms. Smigla. She talks a lot and gives us our course outlines. After we look at them, she lets us talk to each other! All teachers should do this.
“Why did you move here?” my new friend asks. I have a few choices. Do I say it’s because I wanted a normal life away from cameras and reporters? Or do I say what my dad thinks? “We need a change, Desert,” he said, “and this is the perfect place to record the new album.” I think he just wants to relax on the beach. Why else would they choose a studio so close to the sand? “My dad had to move,” I tell her. “What does he do?” she asks. I know everyone will find out soon, but I can pretend to be normal for a while. “He’s an artist,” I say, playing with my backpack zipper. “Cool. I’m Becca, by the way.” And she doesn’t seem to care much. Great!

Not only is the average American teenage girl expected to be the president of the Student Council, but she also needs to have a part-time job, volunteer, and do well in school. This is what it means to be a teenager in America today. Boys and girls cannot just go to school and be average because being average is not enough anymore. People think that not trying hard is being lazy.
Teenager Kristen Loose says, “Adults often forget how much pressure we have. We have a lot of homework, tests, after-school activities, jobs, chores, and we also want to have a social life.” Even with all this stress, people still have negative ideas about teenagers. They think teenagers are lazy, disrespectful, loud, and only care about themselves. While some teenagers may act this way, it is not fair to say all teenagers are like this.
Kristen Loose believes that many people think teenagers only watch TV and use their phones all the time. She says this is not true. She keeps her phone close, but she uses it for important things, not just for fun. Teenagers use their phones to help with schoolwork and to stay connected. With smartphones and social media, students can do homework anywhere and anytime. They can even listen to language lessons while going to school.
Many teenagers wake up around 6 a.m. or 7 a.m. and often go to bed after midnight. They have a busy schedule with school, activities, family duties, and homework. They do not get enough sleep. The US National Sleep Foundation found that only about 20 percent of teenagers get the recommended nine hours of sleep each night. Also, 28 percent of teens said they fall asleep in school about once a week because they are tired.
Teenager Lindamarie Olsen thinks she only has about 18 hours of free time each week. With 168 hours in a week, 18 hours is not much. She does not waste her time on social media or TV. Instead, she spends her time volunteering. She says, “People think teenagers only care about themselves, but I love to help others. I want to make a positive difference in my school and community.”
In 20 years, the ideas about teenagers may change, but they will still be working hard and making the world better. There will always be new students who are doing great things before they finish school.

The Earth to Sky Calculus Club is a group of teenagers who live in Bishop, a small mountain town in the US. This town is surrounded by nature and is near the Sierra Nevada mountains. In the last few years, the club has sent over fifty balloons high into the sky, about 35 km above the Earth. This project is a mix of science and adventure, which is why many teenagers want to join.
One weekend in late spring, I joined them as they prepared to release a high-altitude balloon. They wanted to see shooting stars, which are bright lights in the sky caused by rocks or metal entering the Earth's atmosphere. As it got dark, the teenagers attached a soft lunch box to the bottom of the balloon. Inside the box were a camera, a tool to measure height, and a thermometer to check the temperature as the balloon went up. They also put two GPS trackers on the outside of the lunch box to help find it later. 
They used a gas tank, given by a friend from another state, to fill the balloon, which grew to the size of a small car. An older boy drove for seven hours to get the gas tank. He said, “I didn’t really mind.” For these kids, this is normal. 
Finally, it was time for the balloon to go up. They counted down, “Five, four, three, two, one,” and the balloon started to rise. Some of the teenagers ran after it with flashlights, trying to see it in the dark sky. There was a quiet moment of wonder as the balloon disappeared into the night.
After the launch, most students went home, but a few stayed to watch for shooting stars. They lay on blankets and looked at the clear sky, which was surprising because it was only four hours from busy Los Angeles. I saw a boy get into a sleeping bag and fall asleep. One girl whispered, “We’re the only ones talking.” Another girl replied, “I know.” Suddenly, a meteor flew across the sky.
As the balloon went higher, the air pressure changed, and the balloon got bigger until it popped with a loud bang. A parachute helped the lunch box land safely back on Earth. The students would find it the next day using the GPS trackers. Finding it was not easy, but that was part of the fun. There is not much land with people around Bishop, so the lunch box often lands in remote places.
The group’s leader said, “Recoveries are a big part of the program.” They had only lost two lunch boxes in 53 launches. He explained that this project helps them learn more about the area. This time, the lunch box landed 84 km west of Bishop. To get it, the team had to drive south and then back up the mountains. They had to decide if they should drive or walk, especially if the lunch box was on a high mountain or in a tall tree.
The leader said, “These students know the Eastern Sierra well. What seems wild to some is normal for others.” It took them 11 hours to find the lunch box. It was in a canyon, on a flat rock, near a waterfall. The camera did not catch any shooting stars, which was a little disappointing. But it gave them a chance to talk about science and share another adventure story.

Chloe Morgan did not like science, especially Palaeontology, until she was fifteen years old. It happened by chance. Her younger brother was very interested in dinosaurs, which she did not care about at all. One day, she helped him with a science project and found an article about new dinosaur discoveries. This surprised her and made her want to learn more.
Chloe remembers meeting her first professional palaeontologist, Matt Cornelius. He was young and already famous. At first, she was very nervous because she thought he might find her annoying. But he was friendly and listened to her, which made her feel better.
Chloe thinks that movies like Jurassic Park have made many people interested in dinosaurs. However, she believes that these films do not show palaeontologists correctly. They often show them as strange geniuses or silly people who cannot talk to others. Chloe says this is not true. 
Her job is very different. She spends time digging up dinosaur bones, working in labs, studying fossils, and writing scientific papers. Sometimes, she also talks to the public about science. She believes it is important to help young people understand science better. Talking about dinosaurs can make children excited about nature and science.
Chloe worked on a TV documentary called Walking with Dinosaurs. She helped make sure the dinosaurs were shown correctly. The show attracted many viewers because it showed dinosaurs that looked real and were different from those in movies like Jurassic Park.
Chloe thinks dinosaurs are still interesting because they make us curious. They remind us that there is still much to discover in the world. Palaeontology is like traveling back in time.

When you travel by car with your family, even if you are six years old, you know you are not “there yet.” You keep asking, “Are we there yet?” But when you arrive, it is not “there” anymore; it is “here.” So, if you think you are “there,” you should ask, “Are we here yet?” 
Parents really want to be “there” because they hear this question many times on long trips. Kids should be happy in the back seat. You can watch DVDs, listen to music, or do puzzles while looking at the beautiful views outside the window. 
In the front seat, your mom or dad is there to give you juice boxes and cookies, change the radio, and keep everything running smoothly. But sometimes, things can get crazy. For example, my younger brother, Tim, might put his foot on my side of the seat. I don’t like that, so I put my foot on his side. Soon, we are fighting, and our parents have to separate us while driving. They tell Tim to stay in his seat and keep his hands to himself. 
After a while, things calm down, and we can enjoy the views again. But then, I feel a breeze on my arm. The window is closed, so where is it coming from? Tim is next to me, breathing on me. He is not touching me, so he thinks it is okay. This makes me angry, and the fighting starts again. 
Over the years, Dad has found ways to deal with us. When we ask, “Are we there yet?” he sometimes says, “Yes, we’re here. Get out of the car.” But we are still on the highway! Then he says, “Oh, maybe we’re not there yet.” This makes us quiet for a bit. 
You know you are finally “there” when the adults get out of the car and walk away from us. So remember, if your mom and dad are still close enough to answer your question, the answer is: no, you are not there yet.

John and Zuzi Morgan have opened a café in Oxford, UK. In their café, people can enjoy coffee and cake while playing board games. They hope that customers will love the experience and come back again. Zuzi says they wanted to create a place where people can connect without using their phones and screens. 
The games played in their café are called ‘Eurogames’. These games have simple themes, like farming and building. The first Eurogame was The Settlers of Catan, made by a German designer named Klaus Teuber. In this game, players build settlements on an island and trade resources with each other. Everyone stays involved and has fun until the end of the game. 
Later, cooperative games were created, where all players work together to win or lose as a team. One popular cooperative game is Pandemic, made by Matt Leacock. In Pandemic, players work together to solve global problems. Leacock was inspired by a game called Lord of the Rings, which is based on a book. He remembers feeling scared and excited while playing it with friends. 
Leacock loved board games as a child, but he often felt disappointed when they did not meet his expectations. With help from his uncle, he tried to make better games using the pieces from the games they played. Pandemic became very successful and included a lot of storytelling, similar to video games. 
The rise of video games has helped board games become popular again. Many people now play games on their phones, making them more open to playing board games too. Ben Hogg, who works for a game company, says that video games and board games have learned from each other. 
At first, video games allowed people to play together in person, but then many games moved online. Some players wanted to play games with others who were physically present. In John and Zuzi's busy café, board games have become a way for people to connect in real life. This trend of enjoying games together is likely to continue.

Jamie Scott has written and produced many popular songs in the UK. His story shows that hard work and not giving up are very important in the music business, even if you start with many failures. He says his mother was a great singer and helped him learn to play the guitar. The only radio he listened to at home was a local station for older people, which influenced his music taste. He was 12 years old when he first heard a modern song. Around the same time, he had to choose between playing tennis and making music. He played tennis at a high level but preferred music. He spent his lunch breaks in the school music room learning songs on the piano.
At 17, he left school to become a performer. He formed a duo with a friend who was a good guitarist but did not want to perform. Jamie told his parents that he wanted to make music. His dad gave him 18 months to succeed; if he didn’t, he would need to find a job. After some close calls with record labels, he got signed to a music publisher at 19 because of one song. However, the record labels wanted him to be a solo artist, so he had to leave his friend.
Jamie found success as a songwriter instead of a performer. After a tough time with a record label in the UK, he asked to leave and joined another label to release a new album. He did not become famous right away. He felt he was often in the wrong place at the wrong time as an artist, but as a writer, he was in the right place. He believes he is one of the main writers that UK labels trust to help new artists. He sometimes tells artists that wanting to write popular songs is okay. He asks them if they want many people to listen to their music.
Jamie is honest about wanting to write big songs that reach number one. He does not act better than others; he knows he has a talent for writing hit songs. Instead of trying to please everyone, he focuses on his work. He says that when he goes into the studio, they need to aim to write the best music for the next year. It is not just about what is popular; they want to create great modern pop songs.

Tony Connor is a new kind of celebrity. He is very popular online, but many people, like me, do not know him because we do not watch videos of people doing tricks on bikes. He is a "street trials cyclist." This means he jumps from hard places like roofs or walls to land safely in other strange places. People film his stunts and put them online.
I met Tony one Saturday morning at a BMX park. The local kids all know him, and some older people come to say hello and call him "an absolute legend." After watching him, I agree with them. At first, I was unsure about him, but I was impressed by his bravery and creativity. Before each jump, he explains what he wants to do, and sometimes I think he might not make it. But when I tell him he did a great job, he seems a bit sad and does not react much.
Tony says he does not like being famous. He finds it hard to talk to fans. He understands it is important, but he prefers to focus on doing his stunts. This is funny because his fame comes from social media and the small cameras that help make his videos. He says, "This technology helps people like me earn money." Sometimes he feels like everyone is filming themselves or looking at screens, and he does not like that.
Tony makes a good living from his videos, which is different from the past when people did similar things just for fun. After many years of talking to top athletes, I learned that two things help a child become a great competitor: energy and the ability to handle disappointment. These are often more important than talent. In risky sports, it is very important to be mentally strong.
Even in the park, Tony fell a few times on what he thought were easy challenges. But he got back up and kept trying until he succeeded. Some people do not see him as a hero. They think he takes too many risks. Tony says, "These people may care, but they do not understand. They probably have never tried riding a trials bike and do not know the sport. They do not see that I get advice from experts to stay safe."
Tony is careful about the risks he takes. He explains, "People are different. Some are not scared, and they should not do these sports. It is smart to know the dangers. I feel fear, but I find a way to get past it. I am not addicted to risk. I spend a lot of time planning and getting ready. Sometimes I ride around to prepare myself before trying a new jump. I know I must stay calm before I jump. If I focus completely, I will be fine."

Television presenter Helen Skelton has done many dangerous challenges for charity. She has run a marathon in the desert and traveled down the Amazon river in a small boat. For her latest challenge, Helen walked on a high wire. This wire was 66 meters above the ground, between two tall towers of an empty power station. There was no safety net. She only had a belt around her waist that was attached to another wire above her. To help her stay balanced and not fall, she carried a long stick that weighed eight kilograms.
Helen took lessons from a high-wire expert. Even though she had some circus skills, she found out that walking on a high wire was very different. “The training was a shock,” said Helen. “I didn’t know I needed to be so strong. Every day started at 8 am with a run up a steep hill. Then I did an hour of exercises, and after that, I practiced on the wire for another hour. I also had to learn how to fall onto the wire so I could keep going if I slipped. Every time I fell, it hurt a lot. But I had to stay positive: if I got nervous and started shaking, the wire would shake too!”
On the day of the challenge, it was windy. Helen took deep breaths to control herself as she moved step by step along the wire. The 150-meter walk took 15 minutes. “That was the scariest thing I’ve done,” she said after finishing. “I’m glad it’s over!” But this experience did not stop Helen from planning her next charity project: to reach the South Pole by ski, kite, and bike.

In 2006, Jeff Somers started a trip around the world on a penny farthing. This is an old bicycle with one big wheel and one small wheel. Before this, he wrote a book about his travels in Canada using a 50-year-old car. He loved cars and worked on racing car engines. To save money, Jeff rode an old bicycle to work and also used it to go on holiday to Amsterdam. He said, “That trip opened my eyes. I decided to see the world by bike.”
Jeff did not want a normal bike. He wanted to build a special one. He thought a penny farthing was the craziest bike he could make, so he went to a museum to learn how they were made. After trying to start his trip in 2001 and 2003 but stopping because of a knee injury, he finally left in 2006. He traveled for three years and visited 23 countries on four continents. The best part of his trip was arriving in Tibet and seeing Mount Everest. 
He met other cyclists who could ride up mountains, but he was happy with his penny farthing. People were very surprised to see it as he traveled further from home. His worst moment was when he had to drink dirty water from a stream. He got very sick and stayed in a hostel for ten days without medicine. He had no money for a hospital or to go home. 
Even with these problems, Jeff now says, “If I could afford it, I would start traveling again tomorrow on my penny farthing.”

I work at a university in the US. My team and I are learning about water birds, especially the American black duck. We just started using a special tool called a ‘night-vision scope’. This tool helps us see the ducks in the dark!
We are worried about black ducks because their numbers have dropped a lot. We don’t know if there is enough food for them on the east coast. We have a lot of information about what they do during the day, but we don’t know what they do at night. This is because we didn’t have the right equipment before. The new scope will give us clear pictures, even when there is no moon. This will help us learn more and make better choices to protect their home.
Our work is very hard. There are four of us, and we each work six hours a day. We have studied ducks in different places. Sometimes, I have to take a boat to reach some areas and write down what ducks I see. The weather can be difficult. Some nights are warm, but most of the time it is wet. It is very quiet, so I drink a lot of coffee to stay awake!
So far, we have only missed one day of work because the snow was too deep for our special vehicles. I like this challenge, especially when I think about summer. In summer, we will work in a laboratory and look at our results together. It will be hard to be inside, but it is important. I wouldn’t change this job for anything!

Whenever I tell people what I do for work, they can hardly believe it. But I’m not joking! I spend my days at work eating chocolate! Tasting chocolate is very important to make sure that customers get the best chocolate from my company. Every week, I get small samples from our factory. I check them for taste, texture, and smell. I also taste the raw materials we use, like nuts and fruit. I spend time choosing the best ones to put in the chocolate.
Next to my office, I have a kitchen where I can test and taste the products I make. I also share samples with my colleagues! My kitchen has many machines and ingredients to use. It’s great to have my own space during the day. No two days are the same in this job. Sometimes I am in our food lab, and other times I travel to buy raw materials. This can be hard because I have a young family. But I love the variety in my job, even more than the chocolate!
People often ask me if I get bored of chocolate. I have worked with it for a long time, and I still love to eat it. In fact, I often go home and eat more chocolate in the evening!

Have you ever thought about what it is like to perform in a circus? Sophia Grayson works at Circus Experience, a place that teaches young people circus skills. She says her course is popular because it teaches many skills. Students learn to juggle, throw and catch things like balls or even fire. They also learn trapeze, which is flying through the air in front of an amazed audience.
The course lasts for one year. Students slowly take more risks in each class, and parents can come to some classes to see how their children are doing. Sophia explains, “To have a career in the circus, performers need to do different things. It is important to keep performances exciting and full of action. If you want to be successful in the circus, you must keep practicing. Another great thing is making friends with other performers and learning from them. Being fit is also very important. Circus artists, like athletes, train every day to stay strong. Training is very important, but the best performers are those who want to succeed, have creativity, and always want to improve their skills.”
Some people think that circus performers get hurt a lot or that they only work for a short time each year. But the real challenge is thinking about the future. You can only travel and perform when you are young, and then you need to think about other jobs. The course also teaches business planning. Many past students have started their own businesses around the world and are happy to share their stories. However, Sophia warns that this job is not for making a lot of money! “The work usually does not give you a regular salary. It is also very competitive, but it is a lot of fun!”

You may not know her name or face, but you have probably heard her many times. Mariam Hobson is a backing singer. This means she sings in the background to help the main singer. Many people think backing singers are not as good as lead singers, but that is not true. They often have to be even better! People like Mariam are very important in the music world.
Mariam says, "What I love about my job is that when I go to the recording studio, I never know what I will sing. It could be classical, jazz, hip hop, or rock. Sometimes, I even sing funny songs for radio or ads. I am often surprised by what the producers ask me to do. Once, I was asked to sing like a fish underwater! But I never argue; I just do my job!"
She explains that to do her work well, you need to be very good at music and learn quickly. Often, there is no music sheet to read. Mariam remembers her first time recording music for a film. It was hard because there were eight singers, each singing a different part, and there was also an orchestra. She was scared because if she made a mistake, they would have to record everything again, and nobody likes that. Recording sessions are already long.
One of her favorite jobs is recording for songwriters. Some new writers do not know which notes sound best for a female voice. By listening to Mariam sing their song, they can learn how to make it better.

Julie Deane started with only a little knowledge about fashion, but she built a successful business selling ‘satchels.’ A satchel is a traditional bag that schoolchildren use. Now, these bags are sold in famous shops and many celebrities use them.
Before she chose to sell satchels, Julie thought about different business ideas, like cake decorating and party planning. She wanted to make the best choice. When she decided to sell satchels, not everyone agreed with her. Many people said there was no need for them, but Julie believed in her idea.
Julie worked with her family from the beginning. She worked with her mother, who had never worked before but was good at business. The design of the satchels was inspired by children’s storybooks. Julie did not know much about fashion blogs, but they helped her business a lot. At first, she sold only one satchel a week. To get more people interested, she sent satchels to fashion writers and hoped they would write about them. They did, and more people started to like her bags. Now, her company makes satchels faster.
Julie enjoys seeing which celebrity is seen with a satchel. While other companies spend money on online ads, she uses ideas from the internet community to create new and exciting styles. There was a tough time when another company copied her design and sold similar bags. Now, she makes sure she trusts her production team as much as her own staff.
Visitors to her office say it feels positive and happy there. People enjoy working in her company. There is a new factory, and while the buildings are important, it is the team that makes it a special place.

When Vicky Harmiston was a child, her parents let her and her brother Jamie choose what to do in their free time. Vicky liked to play many sports. She was a good swimmer, and her coach thought she could be a champion. But the swimming club was far from her home, so it was hard for her to train and do her schoolwork.
When they were teenagers, Jamie loved cycling. He bought a special racing bike and started to compete. Vicky thought this was exciting and wanted to try it too. She says it was the best choice she ever made. Soon, she was cycling every day and doing very well. The track was close to her school, so it was easy for her to go to training after school.
Vicky had a successful career in track cycling and won many competitions. When she was 28, she stopped competing. Vicky said, “I loved winning for many years, but I started to feel tired of it. When the excitement goes away, it’s not fun anymore. Luckily, I found a new job.”
Vicky got a job with a charity called CycleZone. She said, “We work with young people who have never liked sports. The first thing we do is teach them to ride a bike. We want them to believe in themselves. CycleZone is great because it brings young people together.”
The charity uses famous people to help promote their work. Vicky said, “Some people think having a celebrity help a charity is not always good. They say celebrities do it for their own fame, and this can hide the real work of the charity. But if famous singers and actors can help, I think they should.”

Ana Ronson is a singer-songwriter from Ireland. Her parents did not play music, but there was always music in her home. Her grandfather played the guitar and taught Ana and her brother how to play.
The first time Ana sang in front of people was at school. She was very nervous, and her teacher had to help her off the stage. The teacher suggested that Ana join the school theatre club to help her feel more confident. After some time in the club, Ana sang happily with 50 other students at a concert.
A year later, her brother, who was in a band, asked her to write a song for them. Ana wrote her first song called "Falling Stars" in just three days. She enjoyed writing so much that she took a songwriting course with a professional. Even though she was the youngest student, she knew a lot about music. But Ana felt that the teacher did not listen to her, so she wrote a song called "Something to Say" about her feelings. She shared this song online, and many people loved it.
Joss Alton, who owns a recording company called Isotope Music, came to ask Ana to join his company. At first, Ana was unsure because she did not know much about Isotope and did not want anyone to tell her what to sing. But Joss assured her that this would not happen. Soon after, Ana performed at a concert in Dublin organized by Isotope. The tickets sold out quickly, and it was a wonderful night.
Ana prefers to write songs about difficult times in life because she feels she has more to say then. One of her favorite songs is "Decision," which is about why her brother stopped singing for a while and how it made him sad. Ana hopes her fans will like her songs, but she wants to write about her own important experiences.

Last year, I went on a great trip. I traveled by boat on a guided tour along the west coast of Canada. It was my brother Harry’s idea. He is a journalist, like me, and he wanted to write stories about the trip. He loves boats, but I do not share that interest. I had always wanted to visit this area because I saw it on TV when I was a child. I knew it was where our great-grandparents lived before they moved to Europe. So, I kept asking Harry if I could go with him until he finally said yes!
A few days before we left, there were storms where we were going. But the weather was supposed to be nice when we arrived. I was busy with work and did not have much time to prepare, but Harry said he would take care of everything, so I felt better.
When we got to Canada, we joined the group, packed our things into small boats, and started our journey. The guide told us that very few people live along that coast. On the first morning, we only saw dolphins and birds. There were islands in the distance, but the fog made it hard to see. I enjoyed watching the beautiful patterns our boat made in the water.
We often stopped to explore the rock pools on the beaches. They were full of colorful fish, many of which I did not know. I loved that I did not have to worry about time. We always remembered to have lunch and dinner, which we cooked together over campfires. At night, we slept on the boats. The beds were hard, but it felt nice to live without stress.
When it was time to go home, I felt sad. I did not want to return to normal life. But I knew I would miss my family and friends. I was also excited to tell everyone at home about our adventures!

My dad was a professional basketball player in Germany, just like his dad before him. When I was a kid, I went to many of his games. You might think I would love basketball, but I didn’t. I liked to tell my friends how good my dad was, especially when he won, but I often read a book instead of watching the games.
When I started secondary school, I was still two years away from being a teenager, but I was already two meters tall. My sports teacher saw my height and asked if I wanted to train with the basketball team. I enjoyed the practice, but I thought I needed to get better before playing in a real game. The teacher believed in me more than I believed in myself. After some time, I agreed to play, and a few weeks later, I played against another school. My parents came to watch, which made me nervous, but it turned out fine!
For the next four years, I practiced every day and did very well. I even joined an adult team before I moved to a special sports academy in the USA when I was fifteen. The coach there trains Olympic basketball players, and it was amazing to work with him. However, I didn’t enjoy living far from my parents at first. At home, I couldn’t spend much time with my friends because of all the training, so that part was not new for me. In the end, I got used to my new life, and my English got better quickly!
I became a professional player at eighteen, three years after arriving in the USA. I had been taller than most players since I was fifteen, but I needed to gain weight to match my height. My coach knew a team that would take me while I was still in college, so I joined them and have never regretted it.

Seven years ago, I was studying Tourism in college. I needed a part-time job because my course was expensive. I decided to become a weekend tour guide in my city, Chicago, USA. I took visitors around the city, and I was surprised at how much I enjoyed it. I saw my city in a new way every time!
After I finished my studies, I wanted to be a tour guide full-time. I thought it would be easy, but I learned that I needed to know a lot more to get a license. All tour guides in Chicago must answer many questions about the city, like its buildings, history, and public transport rules. After a few months of hard work, I got my tour guide qualification and became an independent tour guide.
Being a tour guide is not just about knowing facts. You also need to be entertaining and tell interesting stories. It is important to handle unexpected situations, like if a place is closed when you arrive. Tourists want to enjoy their tour, not hear about problems. I need to make sure visitors are happy, or they might leave a bad review online. Good reviews are very important because they help me get more customers.
I try to make my tours fun and easy for everyone. Because I love my job and put a lot of energy into it, I usually get very good reviews. Many visitors recommend my tours to others coming to Chicago.

My name is Ella, and I am 22 years old. Last year, I went to Thailand for two weeks with my sister, Josie. She is five years younger than me, but we get along well. We went to help at an elephant sanctuary. This is a place where people take care of sick and rescued elephants. 
At first, I was not sure if we would get along with the other volunteers because they were older than us. We were also nervous because it was our first time doing this kind of work. But in the end, we had nothing to worry about. 
One of our main jobs was to collect food for the elephants. Elephants eat a lot of grass and banana plants, so this took most of the day. Josie found it hard work, but I thought it was worth it to see the elephants enjoy their food. We also helped wash the elephants in the river with big brushes and soap. I had a lot of fun, even if I got wetter than the elephants!
The part I looked forward to the most was the evening. At night, we walked the elephants into the forest where they slept. All the volunteers stayed in the same house. Josie and I shared a small bedroom because she did not want to be alone. It was hot and humid at night, but we expected that. The food was delicious and did not have meat, which we do not like.
After dinner, all the volunteers and staff talked and played games together. Now that we are back in the UK, Josie does not talk about Thailand much. But if someone asks her if she liked the sanctuary, she says she loved it. I think she might be a little upset with herself because she missed her friends too much and did not enjoy her time fully. But when she thinks back, she knows she was lucky to go there. Maybe she will go back one day – I know I will!

I’m Gina D’Costa, and I have a flower shop in the UK. We sell flowers to many different customers. Hotels and offices often buy flowers for their reception areas. Sometimes, we provide flowers for businesses to use in their advertising photos. Once, I even decorated a castle with flowers for a wedding. It was a lot of work, but I was very proud of it.
My day starts at 4 a.m. when I go to the market to buy fresh flowers. Most people are still asleep, and my friends think I am crazy, but I love my job. It is often cold and dark at that time, but I don’t let it bother me. The flower market is amazing, with flowers from all over the world. The sights and smells make it hard to choose. If I were buying for myself, I would choose only pink flowers because it is my favorite color. But I have to remember that what I like is not always what my customers want. 
Not all flowers are available all year, so I can’t always find what customers want. I don’t like arguing about prices with the flower sellers, but I have to do it. Flowers can be expensive, so I try to get the best price. 
Back at the shop, we look at customer orders and prepare vases with the flowers I bought. Then we make flower bunches and calculate the costs. Customers are often surprised by the prices, and I sometimes ask them to think again about what they want. Some people might think this is too much trouble, but I enjoy finding the best flowers for the money someone wants to spend. That’s what you have to do when you sell things, and I wouldn’t want any other job!

My city has a modern cinema that shows the latest films and many kids' films on weekends. It is close to my home, but a year ago, I felt something was missing. I wanted to talk about films with other people after watching them. So, I started a film club with two friends!
We decided not to rent a cinema. Instead, we choose a different place in the city each month. For example, we used an old factory to show a film set in Antarctica. It was very cold, which made it perfect for the film, and it was great!
Some places we use are free because the owners sell snacks during the film. This helps us keep our prices low. We are happy to make enough money to cover our costs, but we do not want to make a profit. Each time we show a film, it gets easier, especially now that we have our own good equipment. We can also see how many tickets we sell online, so we do not worry about empty seats.
There is always a lot to do, but when people of all ages tell us they had a great time, it feels wonderful. Our website helps us a lot, and we are now in touch with other film clubs in the country. We have visited them to see how they do things, but it is always nice to come back to our own club!
We started a blog because we know many people look online for film information instead of reading local papers. We also put up some posters in cafés. But the best way to get new people is when others tell their friends about us. The audience loves the special activities we have with each film. Last month, we had a movie quiz, and everyone enjoyed it!

Taking photographs was my favorite thing to do when I was a child. When I turned 15, I wanted to make my hobby more special. So, I decided to start a project: I would take one photo every day for a whole year. Many other young photographers had done this before, but I thought it was a great idea, so I began.
After a few weeks, I put my photos on a website for young photographers. I wanted to create a photo diary and show my pictures to others. I was surprised to find that many people liked my photos. I enjoyed taking pictures of many different things. Then, someone suggested that I should focus on one topic for my photos. I agreed and decided to take more pictures of nature, especially birds and the sky.
Most of my photos were black and white, which was different from what many other young photographers were doing. They were taking color photos. Sometimes, I doubted my project and almost gave up. But in the end, I trusted myself and became more confident in my style.
One day, I showed my project to my art teacher. She told me about a photography competition for young people. I entered some of my photos just for fun. I will never forget the moment when the judges told me I won first prize. I was so happy because my project meant a lot to me. It was the first time I realized that my photography was good, and I could be a professional photographer.
Now, I have my own photography studio, and I have never regretted my choice to follow this career.

I joined the National Youth Challenge (NYC) last year. I wanted to try new things like camping and sailing, and learn skills like public speaking. In NYC, you can do many activities to challenge yourself and learn. There are different levels, from beginner to advanced, and adult volunteers called ‘leaders’ help us. When you finish each level, you get a certificate.
When I first joined, my leader said I should help organize activities at a local children’s club for two hours a week. I was not sure about this because I had joined that club when I was eight, and I found it hard to make friends. I was shy, and the other kids already had their own friends, so I stopped going after a few weeks. But I decided to take the challenge because I wanted my first NYC certificate.
Soon, I wanted to spend all my free time at the children’s club. It became more important to me than just getting the certificate. When I finished the challenge, the NYC leader let me keep volunteering at the club because I made good friends with the children. Now, I go there for about four hours a week, and I always look forward to it.
Because of what I learned at the children’s club, I decided that when I finish school in three years, I want to go to college to become a youth worker. A youth worker is someone who helps children. I never thought about this job before I started at the club. This has been my favorite part of NYC, and I have improved my communication skills while helping others. I have several NYC certificates now, and one of them is for camping!

I was born in Denver, USA. I started snowboarding when I was eight years old. My dad took me to a place in the mountains, about two hours from Denver. The hill looked very steep, and my dad had to convince me to try it. I was too young to ask him if I could snowboard, but he loved it and wanted me to enjoy it too. He made it look easy, and in the end, I did well. 
After that, I really loved snowboarding and got better at it. I started to compete when I was ten. Some people enter many competitions and get bored, but I still love to compete and win. This helps me work harder. I like not having a strict plan, and sometimes this works out well. For example, I was the first girl to get a perfect score of 100 in a local competition. I was nervous about doing the jumps, but I did them and felt proud of myself.
In the summer, I train and study because there is no snow. I train every day, but I don’t have to follow a strict diet like in winter. I also spend a lot of time with my friends. This helps me feel better when I can’t snowboard, which I love and am good at.
I think about my future. Snowboarding is a big part of my life, but I want to have another job too, just in case I don’t become a professional snowboarder or if I get hurt. I am thinking about becoming a doctor if I can find time to go to college. I can’t imagine getting tired of snowboarding, but I know I can’t do it forever.

When I was fifteen, I wanted everything my friends had. I did not think about the future. For example, I did not know what I wanted to do after school. One day, my best friend got a new phone for her birthday. I wanted a new phone too. My parents said I could only have one if I paid for it myself. So, I decided to work part-time and save money. I am thankful to my parents for making me do this because it taught me an important lesson.
I worked every Saturday in a café, but I did not enjoy it. My parents suggested I start my own small business. I had seen my mum making necklaces, so I asked if I could try. I thought it would be hard, but it was easy! My friends thought it was boring, but I liked the idea. My mum showed me how to make pretty things at home with simple tools and materials.
I sold my first jewellery to my friends and family. They said they loved it, but I thought they were just being nice. I wanted to know if other people would like it too. So, I rented a market stall with my mum. There are many tourists where I live, and they bought a lot of my jewellery to take home. Soon, people from all over the country called us to buy more. They thought we were a big company, but it was just me and my mum at the stall!
That was when I knew my business could work, and I decided to create a website. Since then, I have made a lot of money from my business, mostly online, but we still have our stall. It has been a lot of fun!

When Janine Stuart was 13 years old, she wrote a book called Being Amelia. This book became very popular. Being Amelia is partly about Janine’s own life. In an interview, Janine said, “Because my father’s job made us move a lot, I learned to make new friends. I know what it is like to be the new student in a class. This helped me write about Amelia, the main character, who starts at a new school. Some funny parts of the book are about Amelia’s home life, especially with her older brother. Since I am an only child, I had to use my imagination to write about that.”
Janine started her book one summer when she was bored at home. Her mother wanted to be a writer, and her teachers always told her to write, so writing seemed like a good way to spend her time. The year before, she won a short story competition on a website for young writers. That is why, when Janine finished Being Amelia and sent it to a publishing company, they were excited to read it. They loved the book, and a year later, it was in stores.
One review of Being Amelia says that even though the cover shows happy teenagers, the characters face real problems. This makes readers believe in them. The reviewer also says that even though Janine is young and her book is not very long, she is a better writer than many famous authors.
Janine is still getting used to being a famous writer. She said, “At first, I hid when people recognized me in the street, but now it’s OK. I want to help other young writers, but they need to find their own way. For me, I just need to spend time with my friends, and then I will have something interesting to write about!”

I’m Tom, and I’m fifteen years old. Three years ago, my family and I moved to a castle on a small island! My dad got a job as the manager of the castle. He works for a group that takes care of old buildings and keeps them open for visitors. At first, we were not sure about moving. We thought life on the island would be different. The castle is not as comfortable as our home, and there is no school on the island.
After we moved, we got used to living on the island. The castle is not very beautiful, but our apartment is nice. In summer, the island is busy with many visitors, and there are often beach parties. In winter, we only see the other families who live here, and there are not many teenagers. The adults help each other with work on the island, which can be hard.
The biggest change for me is taking a boat to my old school every day. I like going on stormy days when there are big waves, but the ferries do not run then! I also learned that if I miss the bus to the harbor after school, I miss the last ferry home, which is stressful. So, when my friends come to visit, I always tell them to hurry!
We often see beautiful views, especially when the sun sets over the sea. Some days, it is very foggy, and you can’t see anything, but then it can be sunny again in a few hours. It is still amazing to see that, even after living here for a long time. We do have strong storms, and I sometimes worry if the castle will be okay. But I remember it has been here for many years, and it is still standing!

I live in a house in the beautiful countryside of Scotland. I have always loved nature and wild animals. Six years ago, I started a new hobby – birdwatching! I went to the mountains in northern Scotland with my family. We saw many birds in their natural homes. I spent hours watching them with my parents. They taught me how to tell different types of birds apart and where to find them. It was amazing! After that trip, I joined a local birdwatchers’ club for young people.
My goal is to see 200 different types of birds. I am almost there! When my family goes on holiday, I look for birds from other countries too. We always find places where we can watch birds together. I have been to Egypt, and last summer we went to South America. I thought I would see my 200th bird there, but it didn’t happen. I learned that you need to be patient with birdwatching.
I made a video about my birdwatching challenge and shared it online. Many teenagers liked it and said it looked fun. My teachers saw the video and asked me to talk about birdwatching at school. I felt nervous before I went on stage because all my friends and the whole school were watching me! I relaxed after I finished, and my teachers said I did a great job.
I am lucky to live in the countryside. I understand why many teenagers in cities might not think about birdwatching, but there are many birds to see in green areas. I believe birdwatching clubs should try to get more young people interested in this hobby. Everyone should connect with nature, no matter how old they are, and it doesn’t have to cost a lot of money.

I started playing football when I was 7 years old. I would hurry home from school to play with other kids. I loved it, and soon I became a good player. My family thought I would stop playing like I did with other hobbies, but I didn’t. I dreamed of playing football professionally when I grew up. 
One day, I played in a local tournament. A referee saw me and told the manager of a professional women’s club to watch me. After that, she asked me to join her club.
