I didn’t know what other teenagers were doing, like going to the Olympics. When I turned 13, I thought, ‘I should try this now.’” Now, the novel she started at that age is about to be published. 
Charlotte recently told her old teacher about her book, and the teacher was surprised. The teacher thought Charlotte would write a book when she was 30 or 40 years old. Charlotte didn’t understand why she should wait to do something she was good at.
It is a winter afternoon in the office of Charlotte’s publishers. I was going to interview a 15-year-old girl about her book, and I was surprised to see a teenager sitting there. The book is a big achievement. It is exciting and well-written. The only thing that shows it was written by a teenager is the age of the main character.
A public relations person is with us in case Charlotte needs help, but she doesn’t. Charlotte is confident and smart, but she is also calm and not too proud. She knows she is still young. When I ask her about the important questions in her book, she says, “I wanted to ask big questions, not give answers. I don’t have many life lessons to share with my readers.” She laughs and adds, “I think my age doesn’t limit my understanding of the world, but I don’t think I am very wise. I just wanted to explore the idea of taking responsibility.”
Charlotte has a theory about teenagers and the stories written for them. She believes there are three types of teenagers in books: the outsider who becomes accepted, the naïve teenager who knows little about the world, and the awkward teenager who struggles socially. She feels annoyed by these types. “What if you’re just fine? There aren’t many stories about teenagers who are okay. Some writers make it seem like teenagers don’t know who they are because they lack experience. This can hurt their self-confidence.”
Charlotte loves reading famous fantasy writers, but their books almost stopped her from writing. “My favorite fantasy books talk about deep things in life. I wondered if I had to write like that to make a good book and if I could do it.” However, she likes a book called How Not to Write a Novel. “It says if the reader can guess what will happen next, the excitement is gone.”
Some people might think Charlotte’s parents, who are journalists, helped her get her book published. Her father knew someone in publishing who read her book first. Charlotte knows she is lucky because it is hard to get anyone to read a first novel, no matter how old the writer is. “Every writer needs support and a bit of luck, but after that, you are on your own. In the end, writers succeed or fail based on their talent, so I don’t take anything for granted,” Charlotte says.

"‘Remember, speed is your friend, not your enemy,’ said Gareth, our instructor, as we looked down the ski slope. ‘Now, who wants to go first?’ The group looked nervous. Then a guy named David, who had some experience with freestyle ski-jumping, stepped forward and skied down the slope towards the jump. He went fast and flew up into the air, but something looked wrong. We held our breath. He landed hard, lost both skis, and fell into the snow. ‘Remember,’ Gareth said kindly, ‘speed can be unpredictable.’ 
I thought maybe freestyle skiing was not for me. On my previous skiing trips, I liked to practice turns in the snow. I was not like the teenagers who did tricks on ramps and half pipes. I thought it looked fun, but I was afraid to try because I didn’t know how and I didn’t want to look silly. Then my parents decided we would go to a training center for freestyle skiing in the US. It had a big indoor area with trampolines and ski jumps with fake snow. Students jumped and tried their new tricks, landing in foam cubes. This was not a real introduction to skiing outside.
After practicing indoors, we went outside to try our tricks for real. ‘Progression is inevitable!’ the center’s slogan said. Gareth told us, ‘Before places like this, new ski jumpers just went down the slopes and hoped for the best. But remember – if you land on the knuckle, you’ll be in trouble.’ The ‘knuckle’ is the flat part behind the jump before the slope goes down to the landing area. If you land in the right place, you keep moving forward. If you land on the flat, you stop suddenly, and that hurts. So, speed is important.
At first, it was hard for me to ignore my fear and go fast towards the jump. My legs wanted to slow down, so I landed on the knuckle. I didn’t fall, but I felt tired. ‘You need to control the jump, not let it control you,’ said Gareth. 
On the second day, we started on the trampolines. I thought I would hate being inside, but bouncing was fun. Some exercises helped us practice ski-jumping moves, and others helped us learn ‘aerial awareness’ – knowing what our bodies were doing in the air. Gareth gave us tips. I needed to work on my ‘aerial awareness’ because I only noticed when I was about to jump and then I found myself in the foam cubes.
We went back to the mountain to try again. There were more mistakes, but finally, I landed properly. Gareth was happy, and I felt proud. But that feeling didn’t last long. On my last jump of the day, I made myself go fast. I jumped and landed in the right place. Then I saw both my skis sliding down the slope, no longer on my feet."

Imagine you are on a rollercoaster at an amusement park. You feel scared and hold on tight. The ride stops, and you take a deep breath as the carriage goes slowly up. Then, suddenly, it drops, and your stomach feels funny. You go fast forward, turn left, and even go upside down. You scream because you are scared. But you chose to go on this ride, just like many other people who pay to enter the park.
Amusement parks are very popular and make a lot of money. Many people work behind the scenes to make the rides exciting and safe. There are engineers, designers, and marketing experts who help create these rides. Being a rollercoaster designer sounds fun, but it is a big job. They must make sure the ride is thrilling but also safe for everyone.
Most of the ideas for rollercoasters today were created by a designer named John Miller in the early 1900s. In the past, rollercoasters were very extreme, but now there are rules to keep people safe. I talked to some experts about rollercoasters. Professor Brendan Walker, a thrill engineer, said the skill is in putting all the parts together. Dr. John Roberts explained that it is important to make people feel excited but safe at the same time.
To create a great ride, the teams must tell a story, like a space adventure or a jungle chase, while adding exciting features like tall drops and twists. Professor Walker said that experience and trying new things are very important in this job. Jeff Hornick, a director of theme park development, agreed that it helps to love thrills to understand what riders want.
I asked if new technology, like virtual reality, would change rollercoasters. Walker said that while new technology can be exciting, the real experience of the rollercoaster will always be the most important part for many years.

At 25 years old, Miranda Ellington has done a lot as a choreographer. She has created dances for many theatres and dance companies. She also dances sometimes. I wonder why she does both things with her busy life. She says, "Dancing again helps me remember what it is like to be in the studio and follow the orders of choreographers. It can be very tense and frustrating. Choreographers sometimes forget how hard it is to practice all day."
As a choreographer, Miranda teaches and enjoys working with young students. She says, "New dancers are often open to trying new ideas. Working with students can be easier than working with professionals because they are willing to take risks. They want to succeed, but they do not always know their strengths and weaknesses. This means they can accept even tough criticism. Sometimes they challenge what I say, but I like their honest feedback."
When Miranda starts with a new group, she focuses on the dance steps, and the music guides her. She says, "There might be music I don’t like, but I still try to create the best dance routine for it. If dancers do not respond well to the music, it can be frustrating, but I have to find solutions. I cannot just choose a new piece of music. I wish I could try different pieces to make rehearsals more fun. But now, I always work on big productions where the music is already decided."
Miranda does not want to stay with one place. She says, "It is important to meet new people. But I have to remember that each theatre and school has different methods and styles. I need to change how I work each time I go somewhere new. This helps me not to get stuck in my ways."
We talk about a recent documentary about ballet dancers and choreographers. Miranda says, "Some documentaries look nice but are not true. This one shows real life in a dance company. There is a scene where a young dancer gets many corrections. I smiled because I understood her struggle. She knows she is not doing it right but cannot make her body move as needed. It is hard to watch, but it is real. People do not see how much work and dedication ballet needs."
I ask Miranda what makes a great dance production. She says, "It is when everything comes together – the music, costumes, lighting, and dancers. Perfection is hard to achieve, but aiming high is important. It helps you get away with some mistakes. I have worked on shows where the dance steps are good, but the costumes or props are distracting. That is disappointing."
Miranda has done many types of work, and I wonder how she sees herself. Is she a modern dance choreographer or a ballet expert? She replies, "People want to label you, but I do not understand why. There is a trend to focus on one area of expertise. I do not agree with that, but maybe one day I will be known for one thing. For now, I want to explore more."

A friend once asked me why I travel when I can watch everything on TV. I said that TV shows many amazing things, but why stay at home when there is so much to see and do outside? This conversation gave me the idea for my fun four-day trip and a film to make people turn off their TVs. 
A friend was giving away his old sofa, and I used it in my film. I added three wheels and some cables to the sofa and connected them to old seatbelts on my shoulders. I put my bags on the sofa and slept on it every night, even one night on the beach. Some friends came with me to help pull the sofa and cheer me on. 
I have walked on many trips before, but this was very different. It was the longest distance I have ever walked, and I walked on main roads. This meant I could stop at a café and relax on the sofa with a cappuccino instead of sitting on a rock with my sandwiches blowing away in the wind. 
I often told people, “No, I’m not doing this for charity, and I’m not training for a marathon.” When someone at work asks about my weekend, I prefer to tell them how I pulled a sofa 100 miles across southern England instead of talking about the latest TV show. You can watch the film on my website.

When I read about swimming trips in the sea around some small Greek islands, I felt excited. I had never been on a group trip before. My brother was busy, so I thought a group holiday would be good for me. The man at the Greek port looked surprised when I asked for a ticket for one person, because many families visit the islands. I told him I would not be alone for long; I would join ten other people to swim around the small islands. He still looked confused, but he smiled and helped me get on the boat.
Before we started, our group had sent emails to each other, but we did not have much time to talk before our first swim. Our guides told us that a support boat would be with us the whole time and showed us how to communicate with it. We swam a short distance to split us into speed groups, and then it was time for our first long swim of 1.5 km. I felt nervous. I had trained in my local pool and swum in rivers, but I had never swum long distances in the open sea.
Soon, the waves got bigger, and I found myself at the back of the slow group, which was not where I wanted to be. I watched the faster swimmers move ahead like dolphins. I wanted to finish this first swim, and I was very happy when I did it by myself. 
The next days were similar: we jumped in, found a good speed, and stopped to enjoy the view. As the swims got longer, I swam faster and felt happier to finish them. I did not need the support boat much. I can’t wait to come back again next year!

Being a flight attendant is not easy, but it is a great job. Since I started, I have traveled to many places, like the US and Australia. I work with amazing people, I have a lot of free time, and my job is never boring. This makes it a good job for someone young like me!
When I was a child, I went to a boarding school far from my family. I often flew alone when school started and ended. Sometimes I felt lonely, so I asked the flight attendants if I could help serve meals to the passengers. Some of them let me help. 
Later, when I wanted to change my job from banking, I remembered this. I went to an interview for the flight attendant job. There were many young people there, and many of them were also changing careers. I practiced what to say before the interview. I talked about my skills and my past work, not just that I loved to travel. Because of this, I got the job!
I think this job is great for many reasons, but the free flights are not the best part. Most airline workers work very hard. There is a saying: "No one is finished until everyone is finished." It feels like a big family. Even if we don’t see each other all the time, we are still close.
When I am not working, I don’t have to take my work home. If I have a difficult passenger, which is rare, I know the flight will end soon, and I will probably never see them again!

At the summer camp where I work, I really enjoy seeing the children do things they thought they could not do. Most of the children can swim and play table tennis before they come here, but rock climbing is new for many of them. Some children feel nervous, but after some encouragement, they try, and they all reach the top in the end. This makes them feel very happy.
At the start of the week, some children miss their homes. It is not the youngest ones who feel this way; it is usually the ten- to thirteen-year-olds. We do not let them use their mobile phones all the time. We tell them they can call home after lunch. When they ask again after dinner, we say it is too late to call now and they can do it tomorrow. Most children feel better in a couple of days, and at the end of the week, they come to us and thank us because they had a great time.
Sometimes, it is not just the children who feel lonely. We also have parents who call a lot to ask how their child is doing, which is not needed. Often, their child is busy playing games or doing other activities, so we tell the parents to call back later.
We also see some children who come dressed in expensive new clothes. These children often argue when we ask them to change into something more suitable, but soon they understand why we ask them to do this.

'Rock the Planet is a musical show where actors also need to be good musicians. It opened in London last year after being in the USA for five years. In the USA, it won the title of ‘Best Musical’ four times! Doing the show with all British actors was not easy. In the UK, there are rules about how many shows young actors can do each week. In the USA, they can do more shows. Because of this, they needed twice as many actors in the UK. Luckily, the director found many talented actors in the UK, and they just won their first ‘Best Musical’ award.
The theatre in London is bigger than the one in the USA, and it has been full every night. Many people want to hear the songs that became popular in America. I met Jamie, who is 11 years old and one of the actors in the show. He said, ‘It’s great that I get paid to play, especially with a beautiful Gibson guitar.’ He told me that the young actors are very busy. ‘We have normal school lessons every day at the theatre. The teacher is great, but I miss my old school friends,’ he said.
I asked Jamie what his friends think of the show. He said, ‘My whole class came! The theatre gives special ticket prices for schools. They loved it, and that made me feel really confident. My parents come when they can, but it’s expensive for them.’ When I told Jamie I also play guitar, he found a spare one and invited me to play with him and the other young actors. We played a song called Days, which I didn’t know. Jamie helped me learn it, and I was happy when I got it right. I was impressed by Jamie’s skills and wished I could play like him. I was just trying to keep up and was glad the director wasn’t there to hear my mistakes!
The young actors were already musicians, and some played several instruments, but none had played in a band before. They found it easy to play together. Jamie said the hard part was looking natural when they first performed. They were so focused that they forgot to smile! The show will be in London for another year, and it is worth seeing.'
